name: The Subway Online Quiz | 'Seinfeld' - Season 3 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Why does Jerry need to go to Coney Island?
options: To have dinner with his parents
questions.explanation:
To get his car.

	His car which was stolen in an earlier episode was finally found, so Jerry needs to go to the impound lot and retrieve it.

questions.text: What does Jerry do on his train?
questions.explanation:
Sleep.

	After previously saying that he'd fall asleep on the train, Jerry gives in and wakes up with a naked guy in front of him.

questions.text: What does George talk about with the woman on the train?
questions.explanation:
Stocks.

	George tries to look successful although he doesn't have a job.  The woman tries to seduce him during the ride.

questions.text: Does Elaine get a seat on the subway train?
questions.explanation:
No.

	On the way to a lesbian wedding, Elaine takes her train and has to stand up with a large gift under one arm.

questions.text: What position does Elaine have at the wedding?
questions.explanation:
Best man.

	Elaine mentions this to a woman on a train with her.  The whole conversation is awkward and the woman stops talking to Elaine.

It stops.

	Elaine's train stops for a long time and eventually, the lights go out when she's in a large group of people.

questions.text: What does the guy sitting across from Jerry on the train do?
questions.explanation:
Take off his clothes.

	Everyone on the train moves to the back and Jerry wakes up facing the nude man.  He decides to engage in conversation with the man.

questions.text: Where does the woman on the train take George?
questions.explanation:
A hotel.

	The woman ends up robbing George, but upon discovering that he has very little money, she steals his suit and leaves him handcuffed to the bed.

questions.text: Instead of going to court, what does Kramer go to bet on?
questions.explanation:
Horses.

	Kramer ends up earning a lot of money through gambling, and in an episode in the sixth season, we are told that Kramer has a gambling addiction.

questions.text: How much money did Kramer put into his bet?
questions.explanation:
Six hundred dollars.

	Kramer's horse, Papanick, was named after Pete Papanickolas who was the key grip for all nine seasons of "Seinfeld".  Kramer won the money, Elaine missed the wedding, Jerry arrived at the impound too late, and George got out of the hotel.
